caption.p: Histological observation of rat hind footpads after injecting Carr 0.9% saline (control group) or Carr. (a-d) H&E staining of footpad tissue sections from rat in each group. (e-h) iNOS immunohistochemical staining of footpad tissue sections from rat in each group. (i-l) COX-2 immunohistochemical staining of footpad tissue sections from rat in each group. Scale bar = 50 Âµm. The infiltrating cells were predominantly neutrophils (N; arrows). The brown staining indicates the interaction of primary and secondary antibodies and the presence of iNOS and COX-2.
